topic.title: Initiative Q
topic.body:
> [Initiative Q](https://initiativeq.com) is an attempt by ex-PayPal guys to create a new payment system instead of credit cards that were designed in the 1950s. The system uses its own currency, the Q, and to get people to start using the system once it's ready they are allocating Qs for free to people that sign up now (the amount drops as more people join - so better to join early). Signing up is free and they only ask for your name and an email address. There's nothing to lose but if this payment system becomes a world leading payment method your Qs can be worth a lot. If you missed getting bitcoin seven years ago, you wouldn't want to miss this.

What do you think about it?

1541169956_17WCGhYYYbjznWvdnjAoGS74aK9At.body:
> [6561616](#comment_3_1E3EN7XTyQSGuUrQ1nLpKrryhiBLnYEWh9): its a rip off scheme

It looks like a scam to me too, but they just ask for a name, an email address and to invite friends, so I'm wondering how it works
